Docs.summary: Compares two char values numerically.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 CompareTo(class Java.Lang.Character anotherCharacter) cil managed

Docs.summary: Compares two Character objects numerically.
Docs.returns: the value 0 if the argument Character is equal to this Character; a value less than 0 if this Character is numerically less than the Character argument; and a value greater than 0 if this Character is numerically greater than the Character argument (unsigned comparison). Note that this is strictly a numerical comparison; it is not locale-dependent.

low surrogate code unit) of the
surrogate pair representing the specified supplementary character (Unicode code point) in the UTF-16 encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int OffsetByCodePoints (Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int index, int codePointOffset);
.method public static hidebysig int32 OffsetByCodePoints(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int32 index, int32 codePointOffset) cil managed
static member OffsetByCodePoints : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int * int -> int

Docs.summary: Returns the index within the given char sequence that is offset from the given index by codePointOffset code points.
Docs.returns: the index within the char sequence

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if index , index is greater than the length of seq, or if there are not enough values in seq to skip codePointOffset code points forwards or backwards (if codePointOffset is negative) from index.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int OffsetByCodePoints (string seq, int index, int codePointOffset);
.method public static hidebysig int32 OffsetByCodePoints(string seq, int32 index, int32 codePointOffset) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public static int OffsetByCodePoints (char[]? a, int start, int count, int index, int codePointOffset);
.method public static hidebysig int32 OffsetByCodePoints(char[] a, int32 start, int32 count, int32 index, int32 codePointOffset) cil managed
static member OffsetByCodePoints : char[] * int * int * int * int -> int

Docs.param: the index of the first char of the subarray
the length of the subarray in chars
Docs.summary: Returns the index within the given char subarray that is offset from the given index by codePointOffset code points.
Docs.returns: the index within the subarray

format.a: Java documentation for java.lang.Character.offsetByCodePoints(char[], int, int, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.

if start , count , index , index > start + count, start + count is greater than the length of seq, or if there are not enough values in seq to skip codePointOffset code points forward or backward (if codePointOffset is negative) from index.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig char[] ToChars(int32 codePoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified character (Unicode code point) to its UTF-16 representation stored in a char array.
Docs.returns: a char array having codePoint's UTF-16 representation.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if codePoint is not a valid code point.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int ToChars (int codePoint, char[]? dst, int dstIndex);
.method public static hidebysig int32 ToChars(int32 codePoint, char[] dst, int32 dstIndex) cil managed
static member ToChars : int * char[] * int -> int

Docs.param: the character (Unicode code point) to be converted.
an array of char in which the codePoint's UTF-16 value is stored.
the start index into the dst array where the converted value is stored.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified character (Unicode code point) to its UTF-16 representation.
Docs.returns: 1 if the code point is a BMP code point, 2 if the code point is a supplementary code point.

format.a: Java documentation for java.lang.Character.toChars(int, char[], int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if codePoint is not a valid code point.
if dst is null.
if dstIndex is negative, greater than or equal to dst.length or equals dst.length - 1 when codePoint is a .

.method public static hidebysig int32 ToCodePoint(char high, char low) cil managed
static member ToCodePoint : char * char -> int

Docs.summary: Converts the specified surrogate pair to its supplementary code point value.
Docs.returns: the supplementary code point composed from the specified surrogate pair.
